snippet: Francisco Morales Bermúdez is suspected of having 13 opponents flown to Argentina on a military plane. They were later deported to Mexico and Europe.
abstract: Former Peruvian dictator Francisco Morales Bermudez, who ruled country from 1975-1980, is ordered to stand trial for 1978 abductions of 13 political dissidents; opponents were flown to Argentina and later deported.
lead_paragraph: Francisco Morales Bermúdez is suspected of having 13 opponents flown to Argentina on a military plane. They were later deported to Mexico and Europe.

headline.main: Peru: Former Dictator Is to Be Tried in 1978 Abductions of His Opponents
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Peru: Former Dictator Is to Be Tried in 1978 Abductions of His Opponents
